item.description:
@blankfortune wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: Bobbys help tread
item.dc:creator: @g_punkt g punkt
item.description:
@g_punkt wrote:

i find this :
No-Ip TUT

  1. Go to www.no-ip.com

  2. Register an account with them, then confirm it in ur email

  3. When ur on No-Ip, log on… Then ull see a thing with Hosts/Reidrects, click add

4.As a host name, put the name of ur server, like mines PsyScape, so i put psyscape as my host name

5.Then as an ending, put anything ude like, there are none who are better then others

  1. READ: Do NOT Change Anything Else On That Page

7.Click Create Host, then go to downloads

8.Download the No-Ip duc, make sure to download it to the correct computer type

EDIT: Between these steps, if something happens, and your No-Ip program closes, it will be right next to your clock in a little clickable program like this:

9.Once you download it, make sure you install it, when you get near the end, you will need to log on usuing ur No-Ip account you made in step 1

  1. When your there, you should see your server with a face next to it, click the bubble/box and make your face smile (like this —> )

EDIT: i forgot to tell u how to make a static ip, u need this for ur host to take effect

  1. Open up ur start menu and go to Control panel
    Open up Internet Connections

  2. Open your MAIN internet connection, u may have a few, heres mine -

Then near the bottom you see Properties, and Disable, click Properties -

Youll then see Internet Protocol on a list, click it(high light it)

Then click Properties –

then ull see 2 options:
Obtain an IP address automaticlly. OR…
Use the following IP address.

Click, Use the following Ip address.
Then fill out all the boxes with the info below

Ip - 192.168.1.100 (Or the Ip in the steps below.)
subnet mask - 255.255.255.0
default gateway - 192.168.1.1

and then ur done

EDIT: lol another edit, yup, i never told u how to make access points in your firewall ----

1.Click Start Menu, then go to Control Panel

2.Open up your Firewall

  1. Youll see 3 things: General, Exceptions, and Advanced - click Exceptions

  2. After you click Exceptions, click Add Port -

  3. Then put your server name, and then the port number - 43594

  4. Then click OK thought it, OH when your on the first part, make sure to check:
    ON(recommended)

And NOT

Dont Allow Exceptions, K?

EDIT: -.- yeh like another edit, for static ip - Cred to Kevin for reminding me on this

1.Open start menu click Run, then type in: “cmd”
2.Black box should appear, type in: “ipconfig”
3.You will get something like this:

Code:
Windows IP Configuration

Ethernet adapter Local Area Connection:

    Connection-specific DNS Suffix  . : lan
    IP Address. . . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.64
    Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : 255.255.255.0
    Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.254Use ALL of that as the info you put in for adding your static ip

Thanks Kevin for that part

I did it but , if i changed IP , subnet mask and defaoult gateway then my connection was disabled and if i hit start then run and typed cmd and typed ipconfig its say : ipconfig is not recognized as an intrnal or blablabla…

help???

Read full topic
